artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.11; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 282, p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman chewing on a piece of fraying bamboo, cleaning her teeth, looking down toward PL, with strands of hair falling out of her updo and her garment slipping off her PL shoulder; woman wears a dark blue kimono with light blue patterning in star shapes; blue and red morning glories at right
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田刀 {Wada tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 15 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Awake, Behavior of a Girl of the Kōka Era
